Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 08:51AM SunnyCoconut wrote: Nikola - Yes I did color my hair, a few times.  It grew in salt and pepper, so I asked for light brown, it turned out awful (8-7-10 pic)  I thought I looked like Victor-Victoria (old Julie Andrews' movie).  So that night I went to Sally's and bought a bleaching kit (8-9-10 pic).  You can also see my natural faux-hawk hair pattern in that pic!  I think it looked much better bleached.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2010 04:19PM SunnyCoconut wrote: Has anyone tried to bleach their tiny hair?  I was thinking about it but I am afraid of it turning orange.  I only have less than an inch but I think it would be fun to bleach it out!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2010 05:03PM SunnyCoconut wrote: Sugar77 - That is so funny that you consider your curls your reward.  I always had curly hair and spent most of my life straightening it!  Now I have 1 to 1 1/2 inches of lovely straight hair!  My reward for chemo!!  I love it, I can go swimming and my hair looks perfect, I can get caught in the rain and my hair looks perfect, I can drive with the windows down and my hair looks perfect and extra bonus - it doesn't get in my eyes or stick in my lipstick!  It's the little things that make us happy...
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2010 08:09PM SunnyCoconut wrote: Jenn- I have the same forehead fuzz!  I feel like the little Grinch.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2010 04:21PM SunnyCoconut wrote: Well, I did it!  I took my wig off at work for the first time.  My hair is very short, 1/4 to 1/2 inch?  It is so weird and I am very self-conscious but that wig was driving me crazy!  So itchy and hot.  Now I just feel naked...  I work in a very large company (approx 900 employees).  I don't want to put it back on because really, who cares that I have extremely short hair?  Right?  What a strange mix of emotions!  I keep wondering if I'd look better if I change my makeup or earrings.  Silly, that's not going to make my hair grow!!  Ugh...

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2010 10:14AM SunnyCoconut wrote: He said if there were more lymph node involvement then he would recommend scans.  But I just want the peace of mind of knowing there is no other cancer anywhere.  I know the scans can't say for sure but I think I would feel so much better.  I want to call him and request the scans.  I don't think insurance would deny it, do you?
Posts.Title: Stage II - No scans?? SunnyCoconut Tabatha00

Posts.Title: Stage II - No scans?? SunnyCoconut Tabatha00

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2010 06:18AM SunnyCoconut wrote: My oncologist said, "You don't have cancer anymore, we removed it and it is in some pathology lab somewhere."  My surgeon said, "It's gone, you are a survivor!"  So I just tell people "it is gone."
Posts.Title: Remission or "cured"? Halah wobbly

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2010 12:00PM SunnyCoconut wrote: The biopsy didn't hurt me so much but the Dr scared me by saying " Okay, one, two, THREE!" and clicked the biopsy instrument.  OMG he made me a nervous wreck!  I told him for future patients, don't do such a build up of anticipation.  He laughed and appologized, said he never really thought about it.  But the biopsy itself was not a huge deal.  I did have a little bruising but that was about all.  I do remember them saying no heavy lifting for a while but I don't remember the timeframe. I wish you the very best!!
